head.name: TAN keywords for types of groups
head.desc: Definitive list of key terms used for types of groups.

item.name: attr n
attribute n
tan lm
item.desc: The group contains items that define groups relevant only in the context of @n

item.name: div types
item.desc: The group contains items that define groups of division types

item.name: does not start new line
no new line start
inline start
not nls
not(^\n)
item.desc: Text divisions that typically do not begin on a new line

item.name: no new line end
does not end new line
inline end
not nle
not(\n$)
item.desc: Text divisions whose termination does not force the next text division to start a new line

item.name: start new line
new line start
nls
^\n
item.desc: Text divisions that typically begin on a new line

item.name: new line end
end new line
nle
\n$
item.desc: Text divisions whose termination forces the next text division to start a new line

item.name: start extra leading
extra leading start
space above
item.desc: Text divisions that typically begin with extra leading (a horizontal line of white space)

item.name: end extra leading
extra leading end
space below
item.desc: Text divisions that typically end with extra leading (a horizontal line of white space)

item.name: start new column
new column start
ncs
item.desc: Text divisions that typically begin on a new column

item.name: new column end
end new column
nce
item.desc: Text divisions whose termination forces the next text division to start a new column

item.name: start new page
new page start
nps
item.desc: Text divisions that typically begin on a new page

item.name: new page end
end new page
npe
item.desc: Text divisions whose termination forces the next text division to start a new page

item.name: logical
conceptual
item.desc: Text division is based on logical units that do not depend upon scripta for their meaning, e.g., sentence, paragraph. Contrasts with physical, scriptum-based divisions.

item.name: scriptum
scriptum based
object
physical
material
item.desc: Text division is based on a physical feature in the scriptum, e.g., page, column, line. Contrasts with logical divisions.

item.name: status
base
item.desc: @n is the result of applying tan:string-base($i), where $i is the value of the token chosen.

item.name: root
item.desc: @n is the root of the token chosen

item.name: start1
a
item.desc: @n is the first letter of the token chosen

item.name: start2
ab
item.desc: @n is the first two letters of the token chosen

item.name: start3
abc
item.desc: @n is the first three letters of the token chosen

item.name: end1
z
item.desc: @n is the last letter of the token chosen

item.name: end2
yz
item.desc: @n is the last two letters of the token chosen

item.name: end3
xyz
item.desc: @n is the last three letters of the token chosen
